item.title: Assassin's Creed Syndicate Gets Surprise 60 FPS Update
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/assassins-creed-syndicate-ps5-xbox-x-60fps-patch-free-1851701990

One of the best Assassin’s Creed games ever released, Syndicate, has received a small but greatly appreciated update that lets the open-world action game run at 60FPS on current-gen consoles.

Suggested Reading

The Week In Games: What’s Coming Out Beyond Assassin's Creed Mirage

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

On November 18, Ubisoft announced that 2015's Assassin’s Creed Syndicate had received a new update. However, this small patch didn’t add some new area to the game, fix a bunch of old bugs, add a bonus weapon, or anything like that. Instead, Ubisoft’s new update for Syndicate lets you play the Assassin’s Creed sequel at 60 FPS on PS5, PS5 Pro, Xbox Series X, and Xbox Series S.

“Revisit the Assassin fantasy and take down your enemies more smoothly than ever [with] Assassin’s Creed Syndicate’s free 60 FPS patch. Roam London’s streets in a whole new light and elevate your gaming experience with doubled framerate on Xbox Series X|S, PS5, and PS5 Pro,” said Ubisoft in a post announcing the patch.

It’s nice to see Ubisoft going back and updating an older, but still excellent game, letting us take advantage of the more powerful current-gen consoles that we have today. Even better, on Xbox Series X, PS5, and PS5 Pro you can play Assassin’s Creed Syndicate in 4K resolution at 60 FPS. Xbox Series S only runs at 1080p, but still gets a 60 FPS boost, too.

It’s ironic to see Syndicate—a very good Assassin’s Creed game with a wonderful map and one of the best endings in the franchise—receive a PS5 patch that makes it run better on Sony’s console. Back in 2020, shortly after the PS5 originally launched, Syndicate was one of a handful of games that didn’t work properly on the console via backward compatibility. Now, it’s one of the best ways to play the open-world London murder simulator. Funny how things work, huh?

  .

item.title: Here Are Your 2024 GOTY Nominees For Geoff Keighley's 10th Annual Game Awards
item.content:encoded:
https://kotaku.com/game-awards-2024-nominees-goty-tga-black-myth-keighley-1851701923

The nominees for The Game Awards 2024 have been revealed, and they will offer plenty for fans to fight over. The 10th anniversary of host Geoff Keighley’s Oscars-like celebration of interactive arts will choose from the following for the best game of the year: Astro Bot, Balatro, Black Myth Wukong, Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree, Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth, and Metaphor: Refantazio.

Suggested Reading

The Most Sought After Elden Ring Sword Has A Storied History

  • Off
  • English

Suggested Reading

The Game Awards will be livestreamed on December 12 starting at 8:00 p.m. ET on YouTube and elsewhere, with a pre-show that begins half an hour earlier. In the meantime, the jury made of global press outlets and content creators that selects the winners in each TGA category will cast their final votes from among the current lists of nominees. An online community vote from the general public will also take place, with the results contributing to 10 percent of the overall tallies.

A new FAQ for the Game Awards also recently revealed that expansions will be eligible for the top GOTY prize for the first time at the show. That obviously coincides with the release of Elden Ring’s Shadow of the Erdtree DLC this year, but also several other big expansions, including Destiny 2's The Final Shape. With 2024 lacking clear frontrunners the likes of last year’s The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, Baldur’s Gate 3, and Alan Wake 2, maybe there’s room for FromSoftware’s update to 2022's GOTY to actually take home the gold in that category.

While ostensibly a time to celebrate some of the year’s biggest creative achievements in gaming, the event also doubles as a showcase for recent and upcoming releases, with viewers eagerly awaiting new game announcements, trailers, and world premiers in-between all of the heartfelt acceptance speech speedrunning. In recent years, not every winner has even had an opportunity to speak at the event, as the organizers make room for celebrity cameos and musical performances. One thing you can always count on at the Game Awards is that Metal Gear creator and Keighley pal Hideo Kojima will show up at some point and chat on stage for what seems like an eternity.

Here’s the full list of Game Awards 2024 nominees:

Game of the Year

  • Astro Bot
  • Balatro
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio

Best Game Direction

  • Astro Bot
  • Balatro
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  • Metapahor: ReFantazio

Best Narrative

  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth
  • Metaphor: ReFantanzio
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II
  • Silent Hill 2

Best Art Direction

  • Astro Bot
  • Black Myth: Wukong
  • Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Neva

Best Score and Music

  • Astro Bot
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio
  • Silent Hill 2
  • Stellar Blade

Best Audio Design

  • Astro Bot
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Final Fantasy VII Rebirth
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade 2
  • Silent Hill 2

Best Adaptation

  • Arcane
  • Fallout
  • Knuckles
  • Like a Dragon: Yakuza
  • Tomb Raider: The Legend of Lara Croft

Best Performance

  • Briana White (Final Fantasy VII Rebirth)
  • Hannah Telle (Life is Strange: Double Exposure)
  • Humberly Gonzalez (Star Wars Outlaws)
  • Like Roberts (Silent Hill 2)
  • Melina Juergens (Senua’s Saga: Hellblade 2)

Best Independent Game

  • Animal Well
  • Balatro
  • Lorelei and the Laser Eyes
  • Neva
  • UFO 50

Best Debut Indie Game

  • Animal Well
  • Balatro
  • Manor Lords
  • Pacific Drive
  • The Plucky Squire

Games for Impact

  • Closer the Distance
  • Indika
  • Neva
  • Life is Strange: Double Exposure
  • Senua’s Saga: Hellblade II
  • Tales of Kenzera: Zau

Best Role-Playing Game

  • Dragon’s Dogma 2
  • Elden Ring Shadow of the Erdtree
  • Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
  • Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth
  • Metaphor: ReFantazio

Best Action/Adventure Game

  • Astro Bot
  • Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown
  • Silent Hill 2
  • Star Wars Outlaws
  • The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom

  • Helldivers 2
  • Warhammer 40K: Space Marine 2
  • Stellar Blade

  • Frostpunk 2
  • Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess
  • Manor Lords
  • Unicorn Overlord

Best Sports/Racing Game

  • F1 24
  • EA Sports FC 25
  • NBA 2K25
  • Top Spin 2K25
  • WWE 2K24

Best Multiplayer Game

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6
  • Helldivers 2
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree
  • Tekken 8
  • Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Best Fighting Game

  • Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO
  • Granblue Fantasy Versus: Rising
  • Marvel vs Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics
  • MultiVersus
  • Tekken 8

Best Ongoing Game

  • Destiny 2
  • Diablo IV
  • Final Fantasy XIV

  • Helldivers 2

Best Community Support

  • Final Fantasy XIV
  • Fortnite
  • Helldivers 2
  • No Man’s Sky

  • Zenless Zone Zero

Best Family Game

  • Super Mario Party Jamboree

  • NAVI (Counter-Strike)
  • T1 (League of Legends)
  • Team Liquid (Dota 2)

Best Esports Player

  • 33 – Neta Shapira
  • Aleksib – Aleksi Virolainen
  • Chovy – Jeong Ji-hoon
  • Faker – Lee Sang-hyeok
  • ZyWoO – Mathieu Herbaut
  • ZmjjKk – Zheng Yongkang

Content Creator of the Year

  • CaseOh
  • IlloJuan
  • Techno Gamerz
  • TypicalGamer
  • Usada Pekora
